name: v5.1.0
body:
##### New features
* Include more helpful info in the exception message when `libmediainfo` cannot be found (#24)
* Update bundled MediaInfo to [v21.03](https://github.com/MediaArea/MediaInfoLib/releases/v21.03) (Windows and OSX wheels)

name: v5.0.4
body:
##### New features
* Remove `setuptools` runtime requirement by replacing `pkg_resources` with `importlib.metadata` (#110, #111)
* `__version__` is now an empty string if the package is not installed

##### Miscellaneous
* Use `setuptools_scm` programatically in Sphinx's configuration instead of calling `setup.py --version`

name: v5.0.3
body:
##### Bug fixes
* Fix `TypeError` when parsing certain files (#100)

name: v5.0.2
body:
##### Bug fixes
* Succeed in fixing upload to PyPI from Travis (tests were broken by v5.0)

name: v5.0.1
body:
##### Bug fixes
* Travis: attempt to fix upload to PyPI

name: v5.0
body:
##### Breaking changes
* :warning:  Drop support for Python 2.7, 3.4 and 3.5
* `MediaInfo.parse`: remove the deprecated `text` parameter

##### New features
* `MediaInfo`: add shortcuts to tracks by type: `audio_tracks`, `video_tracks`, etc. (#95)

##### Miscellaneous
* Add type hints and a lot of code quality checks to the CI (pylint, mypy, black, etc.)
* Run tests with tox

name: v4.3
body:
#### :warning: This is the last major release that supports Python 2.7, 3.4 and 3.5. Version 5 will only support Python ≥ 3.6

##### New features
* `MediaInfo.parse`: add support for file-like objects (#96)
* Update bundled MediaInfo to [v20.09](https://github.com/MediaArea/MediaInfoLib/releases/v20.09) (Windows and OSX wheels)
* Improvements to documentation
* Python 3.9 is now officially supported

name: v4.2.1
body:
##### Bug fixes
* Fix version detection for Read the Docs documentation builds

name: v4.2
body:
##### New features
* Add a new `output` option to the `parse` method, this deprecates the old `test` option (#82)
* Update bundled MediaInfo to [v20.03](https://github.com/MediaArea/MediaInfoLib/releases/v20.03) (Windows and OSX wheels)
* Add support for os.PathLike objects (#72)

##### Bug fixes
* Close and delete handle on errors to avoid memory leaks (#79)
* Fix thread-safety that was broken since v4.1 (#76 and #83), document multi-threading limitations
* Document Python 3.8 support 
* Show the correct pymediainfo version in documentation builds

name: v4.1
body:
* Add an argument to pass custom options to the parse method (#71)
* Update bundled MediaInfo to [v19.09](https://github.com/MediaArea/MediaInfoLib/releases/tag/v19.09) (Windows and OSX wheels)

name: v4.0
body:
* Drop Python 2.6 compatibility
* Allow pickling of Track instances (#68)
* Remove xml attributes from `Track` and `MediaInfo` objects, populate the `tracks` attribute immediately (03f6242bf6d3d7cf0afaa4156397971f152fa922)
* Implement  `__eq__`  for`Track` and `MediaInfo` objects
* Add an option to obtain MediaInfo's text output (#66)
* Add an option to return non-complete MediaInfo (#66)
* Disable `LegacyStreamDisplay` explicitly by default, make it configurable (see 9aa65d8387723e6c32c1570d67c4c9c019ad3cbc for details)

name: v3.2.1
body: * Generate sdists on Linux instead of OSX (#67)

name: v3.2
body: * Publish wheels containing libmediainfo (#59, thanks to @bgermann)

name: v3.1
body: * Add an option to control parsing speed (#65)

name: v3.0
body:
* Do not ignore exceptions when invalid XML is passed (#53)
* Raise RuntimeError if parsing fails
* Add an option to ignore UTF-8 encoding errors, fixes (#54)
* Use proper XPath to detect track elements in XML (#55)
* Fix handling of non-existent files
* Fix tests with libmediainfo ≥ 18.08 (#58)
* Try to load libmediainfo from the module folder

name: v2.3.0
body:
* Add setuptools to install_requires (#50)
* Add an option to extract cover_data for libmediainfo ≥  18.03 (#51)
* Get version from `setuptools_scm`

name: v2.2.1
body:
* Fix library loading by path on 32-bit Windows (#48)
* Do not fail if the package is not installed
* Add continuous integration on OSX and Windows

name: v2.2.0
body:
* Support MediaInfo v17.10
* Make  `parse` support non-standard library locations (#24)
* Make `parse` support pathlib objects (#40)
* Add PyPy and PyPy3 support
* Run tests with pytest instead of nose
* Update libmediainfo to v17.10 for Travis CI

name: v2.1.9
body: * Make sure docs are included in source distributions

name: v2.1.8
body: * Make sure tests are included in source distributions

name: v2.1.7
body:
* Allow URL parsing again (#36)
* Python 3.6 support

name: v2.1.6
body: - Add a `can_parse` method (#34)
- Support Python 2.6 (#27)

- Fix unicode file names on Mac OS X
- Minor doc fixes

name: v2.1.3
body: - Fix parsing of unicode file names with Python 2 (#22)

name: v2.1.2
body:
- Fix segfaults (#21, #26)
- Use wchar_t functions for all calls
- Improve Mac OS support by looking for an alternative library name
- Add Travis CI

- Add Mac OS support
- Properly handle files with unicode metadata with Python 3 (#23)
- Fix wrong number of argument in calls to a library function (#25)
- Fix doc build
- Remove dependency on six

name: v2.0
body:
- Take over maintenance from Patrick
- Use the library instead of the CLI binary, makes `MediaInfo.parse()` work on Windows as well
- Use `xml.etree` from Python's stdlib instead of Beautiful Soup; please open an [issue](https://github.com/sbraz/pymediainfo/issues) if you experience regressions
- Fix tests, add one for `MediaInfo.parse()`
